Happy #Juneteenth!

We’ve come a long way, but we’ve got further to go to achieve full equality and healing. That’s why I’m also proud to support #HR40 and am encouraged by today’s hearing on reparations. So as we celebrate #Juneteenth, let’s also take today to reflect on the work ahead.

Growing up in El Paso, #Juneteenth was always a special occasion. So today – especially as we mark 400 years since enslaved Africans first arrived in the US – we celebrate the incredible path African Americans have traveled and honor those who gave so much to bring us here today.

The army’s declaration marked the beginning of what would truly be the final days of slavery in the United States. And every year since, African Americans around the country have celebrated this historic anniversary. #Juneteenth

On June 19, 1865, Union soldiers marched to Galveston, Texas, with news that the Civil War had ended and that slavery was abolished. More than two years after the Emancipation Proclamation, around 250,000 slaves had yet to be freed in Texas. #Juneteenth

It is disgraceful that Gary, Chad, and other innocent Americans are being used as political pawns by this president. Families can’t afford to go weeks on end without a paycheck. President Trump needs to stop holding this country hostage and come to the table.
Chad just applied for unemployment assistance for the first time. He told me that the shutdown “is stressful and uncertain at best. I am trying my best to stay positive.”

I also spoke with Chad, who works for the FDA. He and his husband rely on both their incomes to afford their 1 bedroom apartment in Oakland. Their rent for January is covered, but if Chad isn’t back to work by the end of the month, he isn’t sure how they’ll pay for February.

Gary’s last paycheck covered January’s rent – but since he didn’t get a paycheck on Friday, he can’t afford his utilities, car payment, or health insurance bill. His message to President Trump: “When you shutdown the government, you shut us down, too.”

For weeks, I’ve been hearing from furloughed constituents across the East Bay who aren’t receiving paychecks and have no way to pay the bills. Constituents like Gary, who works for the Treasury Department and hasn’t been paid since Dec 31st.

The #TrumpShutdown is upending lives across the country. Today, I met with furloughed constituents to hear their #ShutdownStories.
